abstract: Analysts said that growing unemployment and a deepening recession would force many weaker banks to close over the rest of the year.
snippet: Analysts said that growing unemployment and a deepening recession would force many weaker banks to close over the rest of the year.
lead_paragraph: At 9:39 a.m. Wednesday, an operations manager in JPMorgan Chase’s Tampa offices pushed a button and wired $25 billion in taxpayer money back to Washington. With that transfer and others like it across the country, 10 banks returned their slice of the financial bailout, freeing themselves from the stigma of a government lifeline and the increased oversight that went with it.

headline.main: S.&P. Cuts Credit Ratings at 22 Banks, 5 to Junk
headline.print_headline: S.&P. Cuts Credit Ratings At 22 Banks, 5 to Junk

byline.original: By Jack Healy and Eric Dash

abstract: JPMorgan Chase and nine other big banks said they had repaid the federal assistance money that they had received during the height of the financial crisis.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase and nine other big banks said they had repaid the federal assistance money that they had received during the height of the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: Update | 4:17 p.m. JPMorgan Chase and nine other big banks said Wednesday that they had repaid the federal assistance money that they received in the fall during the height of the financial crisis.

headline.main: JPMorgan and 9 Other Banks Repay TARP Money
